forecasts.title: Will Boris Johnson return as the leader of the UK Conservative Party before 2026?

question_details.title: Will Boris Johnson return as the leader of the UK Conservative Party before 2026?
question_details.description:
This question is synced with an identical question on Metaculus. The original question opened on 2022-10-27 05:00:00 and can be found [here](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/12613). This question will resolve to the same value as the synced question. The original question's background info at this time is below. 

[Alexander Boris de Pfeffel Johnson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boris_Johnson), born 19 June 1964, is a British politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party from 2019 to 2022. He previously served as Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs from 2016 to 2018 and as Mayor of London from 2008 to 2016. Johnson has been Member of Parliament (MP) for Uxbridge and South Ruislip since 2015, having previously been MP for Henley from 2001 to 2008.

In 2022, Johnson resigned the leadership of the Conservative Party subsequent to [a wave of resignations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_United_Kingdom_government_crisis) from his cabinet and government, following numerous scandals. Following a leadership contest, he was succeeded in September 2022 by Liz Truss.

However, there is speculation that should Truss fare poorly as leader, she may be replaced swiftly, and Johnson may make a comeback. As of September 26, 2022, [according to betting exchange Smarkets](https://twitter.com/SmarketsPol/status/1574408957124386818):

>Boris Johnson is now second favourite to be the next Prime Minister — behind only Keir Starmer — suggesting that in the event Liz Truss goes before the next election, Johnson would be favourite to take over.

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":12613,"question_id":12613}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, at any time between October 24, 2022 to January 1, 2026, Boris Johnson again holds the office of Leader of the Conservative and Unionist Party. This does not require that he becomes Prime Minister; only that he is formally the leader of the Conservatives.  An acting or caretaker leadership of the party that is intended to be temporary, e.g. during a leadership contest, does not count; he must formally be the leader of the party.  To resolve this question, it is not necessary for Johnson to remain leader of the Conservatives for any minimum length of time.

If Johnson does not again hold the office of Leader of the Conservative Party before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **No**

forecasts.title: How many Major Atlantic Hurricanes will occur during September 2025?

question_details.title: How many Major Atlantic Hurricanes will occur during September 2025?
question_details.description:
This question is synced with an identical question on Metaculus. The original question opened on 2025-08-16 14:30:00 and can be found [here](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/39125). This question will resolve to the same value as the synced question. The original question's background info at this time is below. 

The Atlantic hurricane season typically runs from June 1 to November 30, with peak activity occurring in August, September, and October. Major hurricanes, classified as Category 3 or higher on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale, have sustained wind speeds of at least 111 miles per hour (178 km/h) and can cause significant damage and loss of life.

In recent years, the frequency and intensity of Atlantic hurricanes have been a topic of concern, with many scientists attributing the increase in powerful storms to [climate change](https://www.noaa.gov/news-release/noaa-predicts-above-normal-2024-atlantic-hurricane-season). Forecasting the number of major hurricanes in a given month can help communities, governments, and industries prepare for potential impacts.

This question focuses on the number of major Atlantic hurricanes that will occur specifically in September 2024, as this month is typically one of the most active periods of the hurricane season.

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":39125,"question_id":38461}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the number of major Atlantic hurricanes (Category 3 or higher) that occur during September 2025, according to the [National Hurricane Center (NHC)](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/?atlc) of the United States National Weather Service.
question_details.fine_print:
* The question will be resolved using storm reports and data published by the National Hurricane Center as of October 1, 2025. Any subsequent revisions upgrading or downgrading a storm's intensity will not be considered. The NHC's [Tropical Cyclone Advisory Archive](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/archive/2024/) and [Monthly Atlantic Tropical Weather Summary](https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/text/MIATWSAT.shtml) may be of primary use.
* If the NHC no longer tracks hurricane severity or is found to be severely unreliable, this question will be annulled.

forecasts.title: Will TikTok still be available in the United States on December 31, 2025?
forecasts.resolution: Yes, still owned by foreign adversary

question_details.title: Will TikTok still be available in the United States on December 31, 2025?
question_details.description:
This question is synced with an identical question on Metaculus. The original question opened on 2024-05-11 11:00:00 and can be found [here](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/22559). This question will resolve to the same value as the synced question. The original question's background info at this time is below. 

Congress has passed a law requiring TikTok to shut down or sell to a non-CPC affiliated entity within 9 months, with a possible 3 month extension for a sale in progress. Original house version of the bill [here](https://www.congress.gov/bill/118th-congress/house-bill/7521/text) (the senate folded it into a larger piece of legislation). In legal terms, congress is defining TikTok as a "foreign adversary controlled application". ByteDance is challenging the bill and [has indicated](https://www.reuters.com/technology/bytedance-prefers-tiktok-shutdown-us-if-legal-options-fail-sources-say-2024-04-25/) it would shut down rather than sell.

This question is about whether the service will continue to exist as a result of this bill passing, and in what form. It is possible that ByteDance will maintain ownership, for example via legal challenges to the bill. If ByteDance does comply is it not clear whether they would shut the service down or sell to a non-CPC entity.

`{"format":"metac_closes_in_period","info":{"post_id":22559,"question_id":22559}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
Resolves to "Yes, still owned by foreign adversary" if TikTok is available in the US on December 31 2025, and the US app continues to be owned by ByteDance or another Chinese or foreign adversary firm contrary to the divestment written in the letter of the law. "Ownership" here is defined the way the law does, such that it is deemed to be "controlled by" a foreign adversary. If courts make a ruling about its status, that decision will apply, otherwise it will be based on reading of the law as passed. Details in fine print.

Resolves to "Yes, non-adversary owner" if TikTok is available in the US on December 31 2025, but the US app is no longer owned by ByteDance or any other firm headquartered in China, including Hong Kong or Macau but not Taiwan, or a foreign adversary. In the event that TikTok is sold to a company in another country that is deemed a US adversary, it will resolve to "Yes, still owned by foreign adversary"

Resolves to "No" otherwise.

"Available" means a video streaming app with at least 50% of the current US TikTok user base and at least 50% of the current TikTok content library is available for download to US users on the Google Play store or the Apple app store. If TikTok is renamed but these conditions hold then it is deemed "available." Changes to the TikTok algorithm do not affect this definition. The app must allow users to watch videos but changes to other app features such as users' ability to upload content or make comments do not affect this definition.
question_details.fine_print:
Quoting the law: "An entity “controlled by a foreign adversary” means an individual or entity that is:
(A) a foreign person domiciled in, is headquartered in, has its principal place of business in, or is organized under the laws of a foreign adversary country;
(B) an entity with respect to which a foreign person or combination of foreign persons described in (A) directly or indirectly own at least a 20 percent stake; or
(C) a person subject to the direction or control of a foreign person or entity described in (A) or (B)."

Definition of foreign adversary: "“Foreign adversary countries” are those specified in 10 U.S.C. § 4872(d)(2), which currently includes the Democratic People’s Republic of North Korea, the People’s Republic of China, the Russian Federation, and the Islamic Republic of Iran." The list of countries at time of resolution will be used.
options: Yes, still owned by foreign adversary

forecasts.title: What will be the ending value of the UST 10Y Yield for the following biweekly periods? (Sep 15 - Sep 26)

question_details.title: What will be the ending value of the UST 10Y Yield for the following biweekly periods? (Sep 15 - Sep 26)
question_details.description:
The 10-Year Treasury yield is the benchmark interest rate for U.S. government bonds with a ten-year maturity, widely followed as a barometer of financial market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and monetary policy.

The yield reflects market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and the future path of Federal Reserve policy. Tracking the biweekly closing value enables forecasters to gauge shifts in investor sentiment and macroeconomic outlook.

FRED series: [Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10 "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity")

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":38723,"question_id":38705}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Sep 15 - Sep 26'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the last available daily value of the U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity published on the [FRED website](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10) for the final calendar day (typically the final Friday) of the corresponding biweekly period.
question_details.fine_print:
* If the FRED data is delayed, the value will be taken as soon as published for the relevant date.
* If the market is closed on the scheduled ending date or if no value for that date is published by FRED for two weeks, the most recent available value from an earlier day in the period will be used.
* Only the initially published value for each date will be used (no revisions).
* The value is reported in percentage points.

question_details.title: What will be the ending value of the ICE BofA US High Yield Option-Adjusted Spread for the following biweekly periods? (Sep 15 - Sep 26)
question_details.description:
The ICE BofA US High Yield OAS tracks the extra yield investors require to hold below-investment-grade bonds over comparable Treasuries. It is a widely-followed risk indicator in fixed income, often rising in periods of economic uncertainty, market turbulence, or rising default risk. The biweekly closing value helps forecasters track the evolving risk appetite and credit conditions in the U.S. market.

The OAS represents the average yield spread (in basis points) over Treasuries for U.S. high-yield (junk) bonds, adjusted for embedded options. This metric is widely watched as a gauge of credit market risk and sentiment.

FRED series: [ICE BofA US High Yield OAS (BAMLH0A0HYM2)](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/BAMLH0A0HYM2)

question_details.title: Which states will Pope Leo XIV visit in 2025? (Turkiye)
question_details.description:
On May 8, 2025, the Papacy of [Pope Leo XIV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pope_Leo_XIV) commenced after the passing of Pope Francis. Shortly thereafter, it was [announced](https://www.thetablet.co.uk/news/pope-leo-plans-to-visit-turkey-for-nicaea-anniversary/) that the Pope would prepare to travel to Türkiye for the 1,700th anniversary of the Council of Nicaea in late November, a trip Pope Francis had intended to make in May before his passing.

There is also speculation that the Pope may visit Lebanon:

> Archbishop Paul Sayah, deputy to Lebanon’s Maronite patriarch, Mar Bechara Boutros al-Rai — the country’s top Catholic cleric — told The Washington Post on Wednesday that he is aware that “the Vatican is considering and studying a visit by Pope Leo to Lebanon.”

> Sayah spoke to The Post after Rai told Al Arabiya television on Wednesday that preparations were “underway” for a visit by Leo that would occur by December. Rai told the outlet that the Vatican had yet to confirm a date. “There still needs to be a decision from the Vatican on when the visit will take place,” he said.

...or perhaps Israel:

> Some Vatican watchers have also wondered whether Leo might consider a visit to Israel.

###### Washington Post: [Pope Leo may visit Lebanon on first major trip, Catholic officials say](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2025/08/20/pope-leo-lebanon-first-trip-turkey-israel-middle-east-peace/)

Recent Popes have been relatively consistent in their travels, making few international visits in their first year: both [Pope Francis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_pastoral_visits_of_Pope_Francis#2013) and [Pope Benedict XVI ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_pastoral_visits_of_Pope_Benedict_XVI#2005)made a single visit to Brazil and Germany respectively for World Youth Day and [Pope John Paul II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_pastoral_visits_of_Pope_John_Paul_II#1970s) making none. 

Generally speaking, visits to home nations and states affected by conflict, natural disasters and humanitarian crises are common.

forecasts.title: Will the United States attack Venezuela before 2026?

question_details.title: Will the United States attack Venezuela before 2026?
question_details.description:
Since the [1998 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1998_Venezuelan_presidential_election) and the victory of Hugo Chavez, the United States and Venezuela have had a tense relationship, with numerous disputes over trade and foreign policy. During his tenure, Chavez often accused the United States of attempting to remove him from power, including an alleged assassination attempt and alleged support for the [2002 coup attempt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2002_Venezuelan_coup_attempt). Following Chavez's death and Maduro's succession, tensions escalated further, as the United States imposed additional sanctions and travel restrictions on political leaders. 

Due to the [2018 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_Venezuelan_presidential_election), Venezuela entered into a political crisis in which the United States would declare the election fraudulent and [Juan Guaido](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Juan_Guaid%C3%B3) the legitimate leader of Venezuela. During this time the US imposed harsh sanctions on Venezuela, backed protest movements and even supported an [attempt to capture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Gideon_\(2020\)) Maduro by private security forces. During this time Trump repeatedly [floated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proposed_United_States_invasion_of_Venezuela) a full scale invasion of the country and refused to rule out a "military option."

During the Biden Administration, tensions slowly cooled, though the United States would continue to sanction Venezuela, and continue to declare Maduro's leadership illegitimate. In 2023, oil sanctions were moderately lessened as part of an [election related deal](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/venezuela-opposition-sign-election-deal-paving-way-us-sanctions-relief-2023-10-17/). However following the [2024 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Venezuelan_presidential_election), tensions began to rise again as the United States once again declared the election illegitimate.

After Trump's return to power, tensions ramped up quickly as the United States attempted to [deport Venezuelan migrants](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/venezuela-receives-hundreds-deported-migrants-us-after-flights-restart-2025-03-24/), accused Maduro of [supporting criminal gangs](https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/venezuela/article305820776.html), and [imposed further sanctions](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c62zzv02r3vo). There was brief lull in tensions in July as a [prisoner swap](https://www.npr.org/2025/07/18/nx-s1-5472623/venezuela-prisoner-exchange-el-salvador-us) was agreed upon before a reversal where the US reaffirmed and increased it's [reward](https://www.state.gov/reward-offer-increase-of-up-to-50-million-for-information-leading-to-arrest-and-or-conviction-of-nicolas-maduro/) for the arrest of Maduro.

question_details.title: Which grouping will the Prime Minister of France belong to on December 31, 2025?
question_details.description:
In 2024, France underwent a [political crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024%E2%80%932025_French_political_crisis) when President Emmanuel Macron called for snap elections. The [New Popular Front](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Popular_Front) (NFP) won the most seats in parliament (180), while Macron's centrist coalition, [Ensemble](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ensemble_\(political_coalition\)), won 159. [Cooperation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election#After_the_first_round) betweeen these two coalitions meant that [National Rally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Rally)'s coalition ended up with only 142 seats, despite getting the most votes in the election.

Since no coalition reached the 289 seats needed for a majority, the elections resulted in a hung parliament. Macron refused to apppoint a prime minister from NFP, with the caretaker government remaining in place for 51 days. [Michel Barnier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michel_Barnier "Michel Barier"), a member of [The Republicans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Republicans_\(France\)) (Republican Right) was then appointed Prime Minister. Barnier's government lasted for 3 months, until it was brought down by a vote of no confidence, the shortest tenure of any Prime Minister during the Fifth Republic.

Barnier was then succeeded by [François Bayrou](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fran%C3%A7ois_Bayrou), the leader of [Modem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Democratic_Movement_\(France\)) (The Democrats) who remains the PM as of September 1, 2025, however, in late August, Bayrou announced a motion of confidence to be held on September 8, in order to seek parliamentary backing for his plan to cut public spending. National Rally, the [Socialist Party](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socialist_Party_\(France\) "Socialist Party (France)"), the Greens and [La France Insoumise](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_France_Insoumise "La France Insoumise") announced that they would vote against, which would effectively bring down the current government.

forecasts.title: How much will Nvidia's stock price returns exceed Microsoft's in the following biweekly periods of Q3 2025? (Sep 29 - Oct 10)

question_details.title: How much will Nvidia's stock price returns exceed Microsoft's in the following biweekly periods of Q3 2025? (Sep 29 - Oct 10)
question_details.description:
As of June 2025, Microsoft are the [1st and 2nd most valuable companies in the world](https://companiesmarketcap.com/) respectively. Nvidia's stock price has seen a rise of 25% over the past year, while Apple's stock has risen by almost 9%.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":38704,"question_id":39379}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Sep 29 - Oct 10'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the difference between the percent stock price return of [NVDA](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NVDA/history/) and that of [MSFT](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/MSFT/history/) for the corresponding biweekly period, according to Yahoo Finance data.

Specifically, each subquestion will resolve as NVDA\_return - MSFT\_return.

Returns will be calculated as follows: If P₀ is the Adj Close price of a company stock on the last trading day or half-day *before* the start of the period and P₁ is the Adj Close price of the stock on the last trading day *of* the designated period, the percentage return will be calculated as:

$$
 \text{return} = 100 \times \frac{P1 - P0}{P0}
$$
question_details.fine_print:
* If one or both companies undergo a stock split during the period, the Adj Close prices will be adjusted to ensure consistency.
* If Microsoft outperforms Nvidia, the corresponding subquestion will resolve as a negative number.
* If Yahoo Finance delays or ceases reporting these data or if it reports them in error, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.
* Resolutions are based on the prices at the market close on the last trading day of the designated period. Further adjustments to Adj Close prices after that will not cause subquestions to re-resolve.

***

For example, for the period Jun 9 - Jun 20, the subquestion would resolve based on the following calculations:

NVDA\_P₀ = 141.71 (the Adj Close price on Jun 6)

NVDA\_P₁ = 143.85 (the Adj Close price on Jun 20)

NVDA\_return = 100 × (143.85 - 141.71) / 141.71 = 1.510

MSFT\_P₀ = 470.38 (the Adj Close price on Jun 6)

MSFT\_P₁ = 477.40 (the Adj Close price on Jun 20)

MSFT\_return = 100 × (477.40 - 470.38) / 470.38 = 1.4924

And the resolution would be 1.510 - 1.494 = **0.016** percentage points (pp).

The [CBOE Volatility Index (VIX)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VIX), often referred to as the “fear gauge,” is a real-time market index that represents the market’s expectations for volatility over the coming 30 days. It is derived from the prices of S\&P 500 index options and is widely viewed as a measure of market risk and investor sentiment.

The VIX tends to spike during periods of high uncertainty or panic, often driven by earnings reports, economic data releases, Federal Reserve announcements, or geopolitical events. Predicting the maximum intraday value can provide insights into how market participants perceive risk over a short horizon.

Historical values for the VIX are available from TradingView [here](https://www.tradingview.com/symbols/CBOE-VIX/).

forecasts.title: How will the Supreme Court rule on Trump's tariffs in 2025?

question_details.title: How will the Supreme Court rule on Trump's tariffs in 2025?
question_details.description:
In 1977, the U.S. Congress enacted the [International Emergency Economic Powers Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Emergency_Economic_Powers_Act) (IEEPA), granting the President certain powers to regulate foreign commerce in the event of a national emergency prompted by an unusual and extraordinary threat emanating from outside the United States.

Upon beginning his second term in office, on January 20, 2025, President Trump declared, [under the IEEPA](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/01/29/2025-02004/designating-cartels-and-other-organizations-as-foreign-terrorist-organizations-and-specially), that threats posed by Mexican drug cartels and other transnational gangs had created a [national emergency](https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/documents/proclamation-10886-declaring-national-emergency-the-southern-border-the-united-states) at America's border with Mexico. Then, on February 1, 2025, President Trump expanded the declared national emergency to cover the influx of drugs across America's border with [Canada](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/07/2025-02406/imposing-duties-to-address-the-flow-of-illicit-drugs-across-our-northern-border) as well as [from China](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/07/2025-02408/imposing-duties-to-address-the-synthetic-opioid-supply-chain-in-the-peoples-republic-of-china), and Trump [imposed tariffs](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/02/07/2025-02407/imposing-duties-to-address-the-situation-at-our-southern-border) on all three countries, invoking his authority under the IEEPA.

Subsequently, on April 2, 2025, Trump [declared](https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2025/04/07/2025-06063/regulating-imports-with-a-reciprocal-tariff-to-rectify-trade-practices-that-contribute-to-large-and) that America's trade deficits with the rest of the world constituted another national emergency, and he imposed a policy of "reciprocal tariffs" on the majority of America's trading partners.

These tariffs were soon challenged in court by numerous businesses that import goods into the United States. On May 28, 2025, in *V.O.S. Selections, Inc. v. United States*, the [Court of International Trade](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Court_of_International_Trade) ruled that (1) the reciprocal tariffs exceeded the authority granted to the President under the IEEPA and (2) the trafficking tariffs imposed on Mexico, Canada, and China also violated the IEEPA because the tariffs did not "deal with" the identified threat. The very next day, in *Learning Resources, Inc. v. Trump*, the U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia [ruled](https://www.scotusblog.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/20250617121437410_No.-___Learning_Resources_Appendix.pdf) that the IEEPA did not authorize the President to impose tariffs in the first place. Though the reasoning differed, both courts agreed that Trump's tariffs were unlawful.

On June 17, 2025, the plaintiffs in *Learning Resources* [asked](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/24/24-1287/363370/20250617121408066_No-___Learning_Resources_Petition_For_A_Writ_Of_Certiorari_Before_Judgment.pdf) the Supreme Court to review the case, arguing that the Court would inevitably rule on the issue and because of its importance should do so without delay. The government [opposed](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/24/24-1287/365424/20250717130752166_24-1287_Learning_Resources_opp_final.pdf), arguing that the Supreme Court should follow the normal appellate process, which would involve letting the Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit review the decision first.

Meanwhile, the *V.O.S. Selections* decision was appealed to the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit, which, on August 29, 2025, in a 7-4 decision, [affirmed](https://www.cafc.uscourts.gov/opinions-orders/25-1812.OPINION.8-29-2025_2566151.pdf) the determination that the reciprocal and trafficking tariffs exceeded the President's IEEPA authority. (Of the seven judges in the majority, six were appointed by Democrats and one by a Republican. Of the four judges in dissent, two were appointed by Republicans and two by Democrats.)

The government promptly [sought](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/25/25-250/373615/20250903200201802_Trump_v._VOS_petition-final.pdf) Supreme Court review of the *V.O.S. Selections* decision—to which the [plaintiffs](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/25/25-250/373877/20250905154639340_VOS%20-%20Memorandum%20for%20Private%20Respondents.pdf) [acquiesced](https://www.supremecourt.gov/DocketPDF/25/25-250/374032/20250908160757048_TRUMP%20V.%20VOS%20BRIEF%20FOR%20STATE%20RESPONDENTS%2025%20250.pdf), because of the urgency of the issue—and on September 9, 2025, the Supreme Court [agreed to consolidate and review](https://www.supremecourt.gov/search.aspx?filename=/docket/docketfiles/html/public/24-1287.html) both *V.O.S. Selections* and *Learning Resources* on an expedited schedule, with briefing to be filed in September and October and argument to be held in the first week of November 2025. 

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":39893,"question_id":39438}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question will resolve according to the Supreme Court's 2025 ruling on President Trump's reciprocal tariffs and trafficking tariffs in *Learning Resources, Inc. v. Trump* and *Trump v.* *V.O.S. Selections, Inc.*

If the Court holds that any challenged tariff measure is lawful and holds none unlawful before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Tariffs lawful**.

If the Supreme Court holds that any challenged tariff measure is unlawful and holds none lawful before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Tariffs unlawful**.

If the Court holds some challenged measures lawful and some unlawful before January 1, 2026, this question will resolve as **Mixed ruling**.

In event of any other ruling before January 1, 2026 in which the Court does not issue a merits holding on legality of any challenged measure (e.g., dismissal as improvidently granted, lack of standing, mootness, GVR, vacate-and-remand without a merits holding, a plurality with no majority judgment on legality) the question will resolve as **Other ruling**.

If the Supreme Court does not render any decision in any of the consolidated cases before January 1, 2026, the question will resolve as **No 2025 ruling**.

At its peak intensity, it reached 160 mph [maximum sustained wind](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_sustained_wind), classifying it as a Category 5: the highest category on the [Saffir–Simpson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Saffir%E2%80%93Simpson_scale) hurricane-intensity scale.

question_details.title: How much will Gold Futures total price returns exceed S&P 500 Futures's in these biweekly periods of Q4 2025? (Oct 13 - Oct 24)
question_details.description:
[Gold Futures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gold_as_an_investment#Derivatives,_CFDs_and_spread_betting) represent physical gold trading, typically based on 100-troy-ounce contracts. Gold is viewed as a safe-haven asset during economic uncertainty, geopolitical tensions, and periods of high inflation. The futures are influenced by global economic conditions, currency values, central bank policies, and international political events, making them a key indicator of global financial stability.

[S\&P 500](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%26P_500) represents 500 of the largest publicly traded U.S. companies across diverse sectors. It captures the broader market sentiment, including technology, healthcare, financial, and industrial giants like Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, and Johnson & Johnson. The index is market-cap weighted, meaning larger companies have a more significant impact on its movement.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40042,"question_id":39581}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Oct 13 - Oct 24'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the difference between the percent total price return of [Gold Futures (GC)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/GC%3DF/history/) and that of [S\&P 500 Futures (ES)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/ES%3DF/history/) for the corresponding biweekly period, according to Yahoo Finance data.

Specifically, each subquestion will resolve as GC\_return - ES\_return.

Returns will be calculated as follows: If P₀ is the Close price of the stock on the last trading day or half-day *before* the start of the period and P₁ is the Close price of the stock on the last trading day *of* the designated period, the percentage return will be calculated as:

$$
 \text{return} = 100 \times \frac{P1 - P0}{P0}
$$
question_details.fine_print:
* If ES outperforms NQ, the corresponding subquestion will resolve as a negative number.
* If Yahoo Finance delays or ceases reporting these data or if it reports them in error, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.

***

For example, for the period Jun 9 - Jun 20, the subquestion would resolve based on the following calculations:

GC\_P₀ = 3,322.70 (the Adj Close price on Jun 6)

GC\_P₁ = 3,368.10 (the Close price on Jun 20)

GC\_return = 100 × (3,368.10 - 3,322.70) / 3,322.70 = 1.3663

ES\_P₀ = 6,006.75 (the Adj Close price on Jun 6)

ES\_P₁ = 6,010.21 (the Close price on Jun 20)

ES\_return = 100 × (6,010.21 - 6,006.75) / 6,006.75 = 0.0576

And the resolution would be 1.3663 - 0.0576 = **1.3087** percentage points (pp).

question_details.title: Will the following companies be added to the S&P 500 before 2026? (ARES)
question_details.description:
The [S\&P 500 Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%26P_500) is a stock market index that measures the stock performance of 500 large companies listed on stock exchanges in the United States. The index is maintained by [S\&P Dow Jones Indices](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%26P_Dow_Jones_Indices), and inclusion decisions are based on factors such as market capitalization, liquidity, financial viability, and sector representation. Current index constituents can be viewed [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_S%26P_500_companies#S\&P_500_component_stocks).

S\&P 500 membership is valued by corporations because it indicates success and boosts brand awareness.

To join S\&P 500 a company must fulfill the following requirements:

* It must have a market capitalization of at least \$20.5 billion.
* It must be domiciled in the U.S.
* It must be a corporation whose shares are listed on an exchange, such as the New York Stock Exchange, the Nasdaq system, or one of the CBOE exchanges.
* It can not be a limited partnership, master limited partnership, closed-end fund, limited liability company, special purpose acquisition company, or SPAC.

Four possible candidates to be added to the S\&P 500 in over the following months are:

* [ARES (Ares Management Corporation)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ares_Management): A global alternative investment firm specializing in credit, private equity, real estate, and infrastructure assets.
* [MSTR (MicroStrategy Incorporated)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MicroStrategy): A business analytics company known for significant investments in Bitcoin as part of its corporate treasury strategy.
* [APP (AppLovin Corporation)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AppLovin): A mobile technology company providing software solutions for mobile app monetization, marketing automation, and in-app advertising optimization.
* [CVNA (Carvana Co.)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carvana): An e-commerce platform for buying and selling used vehicles online, featuring direct-to-consumer delivery and a technology-driven customer experience.

Ciattarelli also ran for governor in 2021 and received 48.00% of the vote, losing a close election to current Democratic Governor Phil Murphy. Although thought of as a reliably blue state, New Jersey had a [Republican governor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Christie) as recently as 2018. Still, the Democratic candidate seems to be [up in the polls](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_New_Jersey_gubernatorial_election#Polling_3) there too.

President Volodymyr Zelenskyy declared [martial law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martial_law_in_Ukraine#2022_martial_law) in Ukraine on February 24, 2022, in response to the Russian invasion of Ukraine that began earlier that day. As the [ensuing war](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russo-Ukrainian_war_\(2022%E2%80%93present\)) has dragged on, the government has extended martial law [16 times](https://newsukraine.rbc.ua/news/ukraine-prolongs-martial-law-mobilization-1752577500.html). (At first, each declaration of martial law was good for thirty days, but since May 2022, martial law has been extended for 90-day periods.)

One consequence of this lengthy period of martial law is that national elections, which would have occurred [in 2023](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Next_Ukrainian_parliamentary_election), have been postponed indefinitely. Nevertheless, [some observers](https://www.saisjournal.eu/article/98-George-Kent-War-and-Democracy.cfm) argue that the rule of law in Ukraine remains strong.

The current period of martial law is scheduled to expire on [November 5, 2025](https://newsukraine.rbc.ua/news/zelenskyy-signs-extension-of-martial-law-1753442234.html), unless the government again renews it.

forecasts.title: Which country will host the 31st Conference of the Parties (COP 31) in 2026?

question_details.title: Which country will host the 31st Conference of the Parties (COP 31) in 2026?
question_details.description:
The host country for the annual [Conference of the Parties](https://unfccc.int/process/bodies/supreme-bodies/conference-of-the-parties-cop) (COP) rotates among the five UN regional groups. For [COP 31](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Climate_Change_Conference#2026:_COP_31/CMP_21/CMA_8), scheduled for November 2026, the [Western European and Others Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_European_and_Others_Group) (WEOG) is currently scheduled to host the conference. There are two main bids from countries within the WEOG group:

Australia is proposing to co-host the event in partnership with Pacific island nations. The Australian Commonwealth Government has designated Adelaide as its preferred host city, with South Australia actively committing funds and conducting feasibility studies.

Turkey is the only other country in the WEOG group to officially put forward a bid. The coastal city of [Antalya is widely speculated](https://ab.csb.gov.tr/en/turkiye-bids-to-host-cop31-with-the-goal-of-a-sustainable-future-news-295266) to be the likely host location if Turkey's bid is successful.

The decision is made by consensus among the WEOG member states. If a consensus cannot be reached, the conference would be held at the default host city of Bonn, Germany, which houses the headquarters of the [UNFCCC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Framework_Convention_on_Climate_Change) secretariat. A final decision is expected to be reached before COP 30 in late 2025.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40236,"question_id":39778}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria: The question will resolve as the home country of the announced host city for the 31st session of the Conference of the Parties (COP 31) in 2026, according to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) secretariat.
question_details.fine_print:
In the case of a joint bid by multiple countries, the question will resolve as the country where the main conference venue will be located.

A country will be considered a Pacific island nation if it is a member of the [Pacific Island Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Islands_Forum#Membership).

If no host country is announced before January 1, 2026, this question will be annulled.

question_details.title: What will be the ending value of the UST 10Y Yield for these biweekly periods of Q4 2025? (Nov 10 - Nov 21)
question_details.description:
The 10-Year Treasury yield is the benchmark interest rate for U.S. government bonds with a ten-year maturity, widely followed as a barometer of financial market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and monetary policy.

The yield reflects market expectations for economic growth, inflation, and the future path of Federal Reserve policy. Tracking the biweekly closing value enables forecasters to gauge shifts in investor sentiment and macroeconomic outlook.

FRED series: [Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10 "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity")

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40046,"question_id":40014}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Nov 10 - Nov 21'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the last available daily value of the U.S. Treasury Securities at 10-Year Constant Maturity published on the [FRED website](https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/DGS10) for the final calendar day (typically the final Friday) of the corresponding biweekly period.
question_details.fine_print:

* If the market is closed on the scheduled ending date or if no value for that date is published by FRED for two weeks, the most recent available value from an earlier day in the period will be used.
* Only the initially published value for each date will be used (no revisions).
* The value is reported in percentage points.

forecasts.title: How much will Nasdaq-100 Futures total price returns exceed S&P 500 Futures's in these biweekly periods of Q4 2025? (Nov 10 - Nov 21)

question_details.title: How much will Nasdaq-100 Futures total price returns exceed S&P 500 Futures's in these biweekly periods of Q4 2025? (Nov 10 - Nov 21)
question_details.description:
[Nasdaq-100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasdaq-100) focuses exclusively on 100 of the largest non-financial companies listed on the Nasdaq exchange, heavily weighted towards technology and innovation. This index includes tech titans like Apple (approximately 12-15% of the index), Microsoft, Amazon, NVIDIA, and Alphabet (Google), making it a prime indicator of the tech sector's performance and innovation economy.

[S\&P 500](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S%26P_500) represents 500 of the largest publicly traded U.S. companies across diverse sectors. It captures the broader market sentiment, including technology, healthcare, financial, and industrial giants like Apple, Microsoft, Amazon, JPMorgan Chase, and Johnson & Johnson. The index is market-cap weighted, meaning larger companies have a more significant impact on its movement.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40041,"question_id":40018}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria:
This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Nov 10 - Nov 21'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the difference between the percent total price return of [Nasdaq-100 Futures (NQ)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/NQ%3DF/history/) and that of [S\&P 500 Futures (ES)](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/ES%3DF/history/) for the corresponding biweekly period, according to Yahoo Finance data.

Specifically, each subquestion will resolve as NQ\_return - ES\_return.

Returns will be calculated as follows: If P₀ is the Close price of a company stock on the last trading day or half-day *before* the start of the period and P₁ is the Close price of the stock on the last trading day *of* the designated period, the percentage return will be calculated as:

$$
 \text{return} = 100 \times \frac{P1 - P0}{P0}
$$
question_details.fine_print:
* If ES outperforms NQ, the corresponding subquestion will resolve as a negative number.
* If Yahoo Finance delays or ceases reporting these data or if it reports them in error, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.

***

For example, for the period Jun 9 - Jun 20, the subquestion would resolve based on the following calculations:

NQ\_P₀ = 21,789.50 (the Close price on Jun 6)

NQ\_P₁ = 21,889.89 (the Close price on Jun 20)

NQ\_return = 100 × (21,889.89 - 21,789.50) / 21,789.50 = 0.4607

ES\_P₀ = 6,006.75 (the Close price on Jun 6)

ES\_P₁ = 6,010.21 (the Close price on Jun 20)

ES\_return = 100 × (6,010.21 - 6,006.75) / 6,006.75 = 0.0576

And the resolution would be 0.4607 - 0.0576 = **0.4031** percentage points (pp).

forecasts.title: What will be NVIDIA's forward guidance in their Q3 FY2026 earnings release? (GAAP Operating Expenses)

question_details.title: What will be NVIDIA's forward guidance in their Q3 FY2026 earnings release? (GAAP Operating Expenses)
question_details.description:
Guidance is one of the most actionable disclosures a company provides: it shapes Wall Street analyst models, influences buy/sell decisions, and can move entire sectors.

NVIDIA’s forward earnings guidance is a key signal for investors and analysts, reflecting management’s expectations of market demand, supply conditions, and company strategy for the coming quarter. For Q2 FY2026, NVIDIA announced in its [Q1 FY2026 press release (dated May 22, 2025)](https://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-first-quarter-fiscal-2026):

> NVIDIA’s outlook for the second quarter of fiscal 2026 is as follows:

> Revenue is expected to be \$45.0 billion, plus or minus 2%. This outlook reflects a loss in H20 revenue of approximately \$8.0 billion due to the recent export control limitations.

> GAAP and non-GAAP gross margins are expected to be 71.8% and 72.0%, respectively, plus or minus 50 basis points. The company is continuing to work toward achieving gross margins in the mid-70% range late this year.

> GAAP and non-GAAP operating expenses are expected to be approximately \$5.7 billion and \$4.0 billion, respectively. Full year fiscal 2026 operating expense growth is expected to be in the mid-30% range.

NVIDIA’s forward-looking guidance is a central focus for investors, analysts, and business leaders, as it encapsulates management’s expectations on demand, supply, costs, and market conditions. Revenue, margin, and capex forecasts influence market valuations, investment decisions, and even competitor behavior.

forecasts.title: Will the US government shutdown end before November 21, 2025?

question_details.title: Will the US government shutdown end before November 21, 2025?
question_details.description:
At the time of this question, according to the General Service Administration's[ payroll calendar](https://www.gsa.gov/buy-through-us/purchasing-programs/shared-services/payroll-shared-services/payroll-calendars/2025-payroll-calendar), most government workers missed a scheduled EFT payment on October 24, 2025. The payment has been deferred until after the end of the US federal government shutdown. The US federal goverment [shut down ](https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/government-shutdown-latest-trump-congress-senate-vote/)on October 1, 2025 at midnight, as Congress [failed](https://www.politico.com/news/2025/10/01/government-shutdown-deadline-midnight-00588906) to pass an appropriations bill or continuing resolution keeping going government operations considered "[non-essential](https://natlawreview.com/article/what-it-means-be-essential-federal-workforce)." 

The next paycheck missed (if the government is still shut down) will be November 7, 2025, and if the government is still shut down on November 21, 2025, then workers will miss that third paycheck. 

According to [Government Executive](https://www.govexec.com/workforce/2025/09/just-23-fed-workers-would-be-furloughed-if-government-shuts-down-under-trump-administrations-plan/408505/): 

> Federal employees funded through mechanisms other than annual appropriations, as well as those necessary to protect life and property, are considered either “exempted” or “excepted” and work throughout shutdowns on only the promise of backpay. The rest of employees are sent home on furlough without pay, though, following the record-setting 35-day shutdown in 2018 and 2019, those workers are now also guaranteed backpay.

> All told, agencies plan to furlough around 547,000 employees, while around 1.57 million would continue working.

Previous goverment shutdowns have had the following durations:

| Dates                       | Days | Wikipedia link                                                                                                                                     |
| --------------------------- | ---: | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| Dec 16, 1995 – Jan 6, 1996  |   21 | [1995–1996 U.S. federal government shutdowns](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1995%E2%80%931996_United_States_federal_government_shutdowns)          |

question_details.title: What will be the maximum intraday value of the VIX over these biweekly periods in Q4 2025? (Nov 24 - Dec 5)
question_details.description:
The [CBOE Volatility Index (VIX)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VIX), often referred to as the “fear gauge,” is a real-time market index that represents the market’s expectations for volatility over the coming 30 days. It is derived from the prices of S\&P 500 index options and is widely viewed as a measure of market risk and investor sentiment.

The VIX tends to spike during periods of high uncertainty or panic, often driven by earnings reports, economic data releases, Federal Reserve announcements, or geopolitical events. Predicting the maximum intraday value can provide insights into how market participants perceive risk over a short horizon.

Historical values for the VIX are available from TradingView [here](https://www.tradingview.com/symbols/CBOE-VIX/).

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40044,"question_id":40209}}`

This question is a subquestion of a group question. This subquestion specifically targets the option 'Nov 24 - Dec 5'. The resolution criteria for the parent question is below. 

Each subquestion will resolve as the maximum intraday value of the VIX recorded from the market open on the first Monday to the market close on the last Friday of the specified biweekly period. Specifically, it will resolve as the highest HIGH value for the relevant days in the CSV published [on the Cboe website](https://www.cboe.com/tradable_products/vix/vix_historical_data/).
question_details.fine_print:

* If the resolution source delays or ceases its reporting of these data, Metaculus might use alternative credible sources to resolve this question.

forecasts.title: Will the United States conduct a military attack within Nigeria before 2026?

question_details.title: Will the United States conduct a military attack within Nigeria before 2026?
question_details.description:
For overs 15 years, the Sahel region has been a hot bed for [extremism, terrorism and violence](https://www.cfr.org/global-conflict-tracker/conflict/violent-extremism-sahel?utm_source=chatgpt.com) against many populations. Since 2011 [recurrent violence](https://www.globalr2p.org/countries/nigeria/?utm_source=chatgpt.com) between herding and farming communities, rooted in competition over scarce resources, has escalated in central and north-west Nigeria. 

Three different fronts are active. In the northeast, islamist groups like [Boko Haram and ISWAP](https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/islamist-fighters-attack-two-nigerian-military-bases-security-sources-say-2025-03-26) are in direct conflict with the government. In the Middle Belt, conflict over farmlands are raging, accentuated by the religious groups divide. In the northwest, bandit groups are active, sometimes cooperating with jihadists. In some of these conflicts, especially those in the Middle Belt, the victims have been disproportionately Christians.

In early November, US President Donald Trump began floating an attack within Nigeria, saying he has [ordered the DoD to ‘prepare for possible action’ in Nigeria](https://www.cnn.com/2025/11/01/politics/trump-pentagon-nigeria-action) while accusing the nation of not doing enough to stop violence against Christians.

On [Truth Social](https://truthsocial.com/@realDonaldTrump/posts/115476385101120405) he threatened the Nigerian Government, stating that "*If the Nigerian Government* *continues to allow the killing of Christians, the U.S.A. will immediately stop all aid and assistance to Nigeria, and may very well go into that now disgraced country, “guns-a-blazing,” to completely wipe out the Islamic Terrorists who are committing these horrible atrocities.*"

In case of an attack where there is no credible source consensus that it occurred within Nigeria's territory and neither the US nor Nigeria claims that it did, this question will not resolve based on that incident.

forecasts.title: Will Iran announce an evacuation of Tehran before 2026?

question_details.title: Will Iran announce an evacuation of Tehran before 2026?
question_details.description:
Iran has debated decanting political/administrative functions from Tehran for decades, citing seismic risk, extreme water stress, land subsidence, pollution, and over-centralization. A year ago, President Masoud Pezeshkian [ordered a formal study of relocation](https://www.intellinews.com/iran-president-backs-moving-capital-from-tehran-to-persian-gulf-354450/?utm_source=chatgpt.com), reviving earlier proposals dating back at least to 2009.

In January 2025, the government [stated that](https://www.iranintl.com/en/202501077205) Iran “will relocate its capital to the southern coastal region of Makran,” as a response to Tehran’s overpopulation, power shortages, and water scarcity. Throughout 2025, [the environmental case strengthened](https://www.ft.com/content/c9ec6008-ed62-40ab-86eb-109d47c02d7e) as Tehran faces some of the world’s highest land-subsidence rates due to over-pumped aquifers.

President Pezeshkian has continued arguing that Iran “must” move the capital, pointing to the water crisis. He has now said that should there be no rain by Azar (21st of November in the Persian calendar) the government would have to ration water and then [potentially evacuate Tehran](https://www.lemonde.fr/en/environment/article/2025/11/14/iran-faces-its-worst-drought-in-six-decades-considers-evacuating-tehran_6747437_114.html) if the situation continued further.

forecasts.title: Will President Donald J. Trump take legal action against the BBC before 2026?
forecasts.resolution: Trump files a lawsuit in the USA only

question_details.title: Will President Donald J. Trump take legal action against the BBC before 2026?
question_details.description:
On November 3, 2025, [The Telegraph](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2025/11/03/bbc-report-reveals-bias-donald-trump/?utm_source=chatgpt.com) first reported that, according to an internal whistleblowing memo, the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) edited footage in their Panorama television programme (aired in October 2024) to make it seem that US President Donald J. Trump was encouraging the Capitol riot in his speech on January 6, 2021. 

> A Panorama programme, broadcast a week before the US election, “completely misled” viewers by showing the president telling supporters he was going to walk to the Capitol with them to “fight like hell”, when in fact he said he would walk with them “to peacefully and patriotically make your voices heard”.

> The “mangled” footage was highlighted in a 19-page dossier on [BBC](https://www.telegraph.co.uk/bbc) bias, which was compiled by a recent member of the corporation’s standards committee and is now circulating in government departments. The dossier said the programme made the US president “‘say’ things \[he] never actually said” by splicing together footage from the start of his speech with something he said nearly an hour later. It claimed senior executives and the BBC’s chairman had ignored and dismissed a string of serious complaints raised by the corporation’s own standards watchdog.

Following the criticism, on November 9, BBC director general Tim Davie and CEO of News Deborah Turness [resigned](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/cd9kqz1yyxkt?page=8). On November 10, President Trump [threatened](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/live/cd9kqz1yyxkt?page=4) a \$1bn defamation lawsuit against the BBC. On November 13, the BBC [apologised](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c874nw4g2zzo) to President Trump but stated the corporation would not pay compensation. [The next day the US President confirmed that he would pursue legal filings](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c891jp9j79do).

> Speaking to reporters on board Air Force One on Friday evening, Trump said: "We'll sue them for anywhere between \$1bn \[£759m] and \$5bn, probably sometime next week." 

Despite the strong and fast-paced rhetoric and [long history of lawsuits against the media](https://news.sky.com/story/donald-trump-and-his-long-history-of-lawsuits-against-the-media-13468501), there are many legal technicalities that make any official legal filings challenging, including [President Trump's options](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c0mx28vlp4wo) and [chances of success](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/videos/c4gpyg4505jo).

forecasts.title: In which decade will the 2025 UK Christmas number one have been originally released?

question_details.title: In which decade will the 2025 UK Christmas number one have been originally released?
question_details.description:
Since 1952, the [UK singles chart](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UK_singles_chart) has tracked the top-selling singles in the United Kingdom. Though the chart runs year-round, [over time](https://www.history.co.uk/articles/the-history-of-christmas-number-ones) attention came to be paid to the [top-selling single around Christmas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UK_singles_chart_Christmas_number_ones), which is now announced by BBC Radio 1 on the Friday before Christmas.

For most of its history, the Christmas number one was a recently released song, sometimes on the topic of Christmas and sometimes not. Then from 2005 through 2008, the winner of that year's [X Factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_X_Factor_\(British_TV_series\)) reached number one each year. This bothered people, and in 2009, a successful campaign was launched to get another song, Rage Against the Machine's [Killing in the Name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killing_in_the_Name#2009_UK_Christmas_number_one_campaign), from 1992, to the top of the charts instead. However the next several years saw a return to current releases, including a few more wins by X Factor winners.

In 2018, The X Factor went off the air, and the top position that year was taken by [LadBaby](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LadBaby), a British YouTuber who then claimed the top spot in 2019, 2020, 2021, and 2022 and who consequently now holds the record for most Christmas number ones of all time (surpassing The Beatles). However in 2023, LadBaby stopped releasing Christmas songs, and with [no one stepping up the fill the gap](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cvg6ejq7zpyo), Wham!'s classic [Last Christmas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_Christmas), from 1984, took the top position in both 2023 and 2024.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":39845,"question_id":39390}}`
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question will resolve as the decade of the original release of the [2025 UK Christmas number one](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_UK_singles_chart_Christmas_number_ones).

"People said it was impossible, but now it’s no longer optional."

According to [Scientific American](https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/irans-capital-has-run-out-of-water-forcing-it-to-move/):

> Since at least 2008, scientists have warned that unchecked groundwater pumping for the city and for agriculture [was rapidly draining the country’s aquifers](https://agupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1029/2008GL033814). The overuse did not just deplete underground reserves—it destroyed them, as the land compressed and sank irreversibly. One [recent study](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/sciadv.adk3039) found that Iran’s central plateau, where most of the country’s aquifers are located, is sinking by more than 35 centimeters each year. As a result, the aquifers lose about 1.7 billion cubic meters of water annually as the ground is permanently crushed, leaving no space for underground water storage to recover…. 

> This is not the first time Iran’s capital has moved. Over the centuries, it has shifted many times, from Tabriz to Isfahan to Shiraz. Some of these former capitals still thrive while others exist only as ruins…

question_details.description:
The [International Court of Justice](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Court_of_Justice) was established, as part of the United Nations, in 1945. It is the only international court that resolves disputes between states. States however [must consent](https://auilr.org/2025/10/03/heads-i-win-tails-you-lose-how-irans-opinio-juris-claim-of-sovereign-immunity-highlights-a-crisis-of-authority-for-the-international-court-of-justice/) to its jurisdiction and enforcement of its orders are subject to veto by the [UN Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council), which significantly limits its influence and power.

Nonetheless, many states have had occasion to seek relief from the ICJ over the years. Since the [first case](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corfu_Channel_case) was opened in 1947, [201 (contentious) cases](https://www.icj-cij.org/contentious-cases?dateorder=introduction\&order=desc) have been brought before the ICJ, including five cases already brought during 2025 (by Sudan, Iran, France, Lithuania, and Russia).

Dating back to 2023, the NBA Cup is a fairly recent innovation designed to attract viewership to the early part of the season.

Formatted like many soccer tournaments, the NBA Cup begins with a group stage that involves all thirty teams in the league, followed by an eight-team knockout stage that, unlike the NBA playoffs, consists of harder-to-predict single-elimination games. In 2023, in its inaugural year, the Cup was won by LeBron James and the Los Angeles Lakers. In 2024, the Cup went to the Milwaukee Bucks, who beat out the Oklahoma City Thunder, who would ultimately go on to win the NBA Finals at the end of the season.
